page.title: 03The United Reform Church
page.content:
The United Reformed Church was built by James Cottee in 1830 and sold 25 years later to the congregationalists. An increased congregation necessitated the building of a new brick built church which was opened in 1871. It became a U.R Church in 1972 when the Presbyterians and congregationalists combined.
The present minister has been here for 21 months and during that time many alterations and improvements have been made to accomodate an increasing congregations, the average size of which is 40 adults and 25 children.
